resources.string: Answer the following questions with integer numbers!
1. What digit is most frequent between 0 and 1,000?
2. What digit is least frequent between 0 and 1,000?
3. In a certain country 1/2 of 5 = 3. If the same proportion holds, what is the value of 1/3 of 10 ?
4. There are several books on a bookshelf. If one book is the 4th from the left and 6th from the right, how many books are on the shelf?
6. If today was Thursday, what day would it be after 1,000 days?
7. \"If yesterday were tomorrow, today would be Saturday.\" Which day did I say this?
8. \'A\' has a speed of 18km/h and \'B\' has a speed of 16km/h. They raced on a track and \'A\' finished the race 10 minutes before \'B\'. What is the length of the track?
9. When Amy was 4 years old her brother was double her age. What\'s the age of Amy\'s brother when she becomes 50 years old?
10. A shelf contains 8 books: 4 Roman, 3 Series, 1 Scientific. We take simultaneously 3 books. What\'s the probability of taking 2 Roman books and 1 Series book?
11. My thousands digit is 3 times my hundreds digit. The sum of my tens digit and ones digit is one less than my thousands digit. What 4-digit number am I?

12. On a hiking trip, Bob and his two friends hiked 15km the first day, 10km the second, and 7km the third. If they walked a total of 60km over the 5-days trip and did not walk more than 18km on any one day, how many kms could they have walked each of the last two days?

13. Knowing that you can use each of the digits 0 through 7 ONCE to subtract a 4-digit number from a 3-digit number so that the difference is 8 in the hundreds place, 8 in the tens place, and 9 in the ones place, which are the correct answers?

"14. \"Welcome to the World of Orient! You see before you diamonds, rubies, and emeralds. 2 diamonds are worth as much as 3 rubies. 5 rubies are worth as much as 9 emeralds. Make a pile of diamonds and then make a pile of emeralds, if you can do this so that the 2 piles have exactly the same worth, you may keep them all!\"

15. The King asked you to design buildings to his kingdom such that youdo not exceed a total of 10 floors; on one condition, and that is no building has the same amount of floors as the other one. What are the correct possibilities?
